senses.de: A written report or collection of information about a subject.
senses.ex: She keeps a record of all her spending.

Tips.title: Tracking Progress
Tips.description: Use 'record' to describe keeping track of activities or progress over time for reference.
Tips.example: Our team maintains a record of each project's milestones.

Tips.title: Evidence
Tips.description: 'Record' often suggests formality and is used as evidence or official documentation.
Tips.example: The trial's proceedings are a matter of public record.

senses.de: Something that shows the best or highest level of something ever achieved.
senses.ex: He holds the record for the fastest lap.

Tips.title: Achievement
Tips.description: A 'record' in this sense is a notable achievement, widely recognized and often official.
Tips.example: The athlete set a world record in the 100m dash.

Tips.title: Competitive Spirit
Tips.description: Talk about 'records' when highlighting the competitive nature of an activity.
Tips.example: This year's sales numbers will break last year's record.

senses.de: To write down or store information to be remembered or used in the future.
senses.ex: I recorded the meeting minutes for future reference.

Tips.title: Preservation
Tips.description: Use the verb 'record' when you want to keep information for future use, not just note taking.
Tips.example: We recorded the lecture so students could review it later.

Tips.title: Technology Use
Tips.description: 'Record' implies using devices like phones or computers to store information.
Tips.example: Could you record the interview on your smartphone?

senses.de: A round, flat piece of vinyl that stores music and can be played on a turntable.
senses.ex: She has a collection of old Beatles records.

Tips.title: Music Format
Tips.description: When 'record' is used in music, it refers to vinyl, symbolizing retro or classic taste.
Tips.example: He prefers the sound quality of a vinyl record.

Tips.title: Collectible Items
Tips.description: 'Record' can suggest a collectible or hobbyist's item, particularly in music.
Tips.example: Her collection includes rare jazz records from the 1950s.

senses.de: To make a video, sound, or performance so it can be watched or listened to later.
senses.ex: She recorded her new song in the studio yesterday.

Tips.title: Media Creation
Tips.description: In broadcasting, 'record' means creating a copy of a performance to enjoy later.
Tips.example: They recorded the play to broadcast it on television next week.

Tips.title: Personal Archive
Tips.description: Use 'record' to describe saving personal moments like family videos.
Tips.example: We recorded our baby's first steps to show our relatives.

Archive.wordDefinition:
Archive and record both refer to storing information for future reference, but there are slight differences in how they are used.

An archive is a collection of historical documents or records that are important for research or study.

Archives can contain things like newspapers, photographs, letters, and government documents.

They are often organized and maintained by libraries, museums, or other institutions. An archive is typically used to store information that has historical, cultural, or academic value.

In summary, archives are used for long-term storage of historical or cultural information, while records are used for everyday data management in organizations.

Chronicle.wordDefinition:
A chronicle is a written account of events in the order in which they happened, often with details and commentary included.

While both words involve keeping track of events, a chronicle is typically used to describe a narrative of events while a record describes a collection of information.

A chronicle is more suited for telling a story, while a record is more suited for keeping track of data.

Diary.wordDefinition:
A diary is a personal book where someone writes down their thoughts, experiences, and feelings on a daily basis. It is generally meant to be private and is not typically shared with others.

A diary can serve as a way for someone to reflect on their life and emotions.

A diary is a personal reflection while a record is a formal documentation of information.

Document.wordDefinition:
A document is a written or printed piece of information that is used to provide evidence, give instructions or communicate information.

A document is something that is produced or created to convey information, while a record is something that is kept or stored to provide evidence or to keep track of something.

History.wordDefinition:
History refers to the study of past events while a record refers to a written or recorded account of past events.

In simpler terms, history is the subject that deals with understanding and analyzing what happened in the past, while a record is a document that contains information about events that occurred in the past.

History can be applicable in numerous settings, such as in classrooms, museums, archives, and libraries, as it can be used to help us better understand our cultural, social, and political heritage.

Journal.wordDefinition:
A journal is a book or diary where you write down your personal thoughts, feelings or experiences.

In essence, a journal is a personal account while a record is an official or public account.

Log.wordDefinition:
The words log and record both refer to keeping a written account of something that happened.

However, log typically implies a chronological sequence of events, often used in a scientific or technical context. For example, a ship's log would record each day's events and weather conditions.

In short, think of log as a specific type of record that has a particular structure and purpose.

Memoir.wordDefinition:
A memoir is a written account of a person's own life experiences or memories.

In summary, memoirs are used to share personal experiences and reflections, while records are used to document factual information.

Memoirs are applicable for personal storytelling and sharing life lessons, while records are necessary for keeping track of important events and transactions.

Register.wordDefinition:
Register means to formally sign up or enroll for something.

It is often used to refer to the act of entering information into an official system or list. For example, you might register for a class or register your car with the DMV.

Record refers to documenting information and register refers to formally signing up for something.

quotes.Text: I want to write, direct, produce, but in steps. I want to take steps. I don't want to just jump in because I sold a lot of records and just feel like I can jump into the movie world. Naw, I want to learn the movie world like I learned the music world.
quotes.Title: American Rapper
quotes.Name: Snoop Dogg

quotes.Text: It is one thing to record an album but it's a huge difference when people play it and listen to it and embrace it the way that I do. It has always been my dream to get my music out to the world and have people hear it.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Rihanna

quotes.Text: In the big picture, it doesn't really matter if we never made a record, or we never sang a song. That isn't important.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: George Harrison

quotes.Text: We never threw a record together. Each record was done really seriously, as if our life depended on it.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Patti Smith

quotes.Text: God only made one thing in this world that's perfect - and that's my boxing record.
quotes.Title: American Boxer
quotes.Name: Floyd Mayweather, Jr.

quotes.Text: In real life, I'm far more lighthearted than I come across on the records.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mark Lanegan

quotes.Text: I've never said anything that I didn't want to say on a record, ever.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: India Arie

quotes.Text: If anybody wants to beat me, let them run a world record.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Steve Prefontaine

quotes.Text: Old age is just a record of one's whole life.
quotes.Title: American Boxer
quotes.Name: Muhammad Ali
